entities.name: SYSTRAN SAS
entities.description: A company that provides and manages internal IT resources and systems, operating under an IT charter to ensure security, confidentiality, performance, and compliance with legal and regulatory provisions regarding data.

entities.officeSpecificInfo: Location associated with SYSTRAN's intranet resources.

entities.description: Policy for destruction of personal/private data within one month after a collaborator's departure.

entities.eventName: French Data Protection Law (Loi Informatique et Libertés)
entities.description: Law n° 78-17 of January 6, 1978, concerning data processing, files and freedoms, modified by law n° 2004-801 of August 6, 2004, which SYSTRAN commits to respect.
General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) became applicable, which SYSTRAN commits to respect.

entities.name: Bombes logiques
entities.description: Malicious code designed to activate under specific conditions, against which SYSTRAN's systems need protection.
Network bandwidth, which SYSTRAN monitors and manages to prevent saturation from personal use.

entities.name: Internet Access
entities.description: Access to the public internet provided via SYSTRAN's network, subject to security policies, monitoring, and content restrictions.

Rules for users regarding data handling (reading, modifying, copying, destroying), professional data storage on personal equipment, private data storage on network drives, and systematic session locking.

Precautions for securing mobile information and communication devices, including authentication (password, fingerprint, facial recognition), limited local data storage on laptops, and physical anti-theft measures.
User identifiers are recorded when navigating the web, allowing visited site managers to link activity to SYSTRAN.
Access to certain sites, browser configuration, and file downloads may be restricted or prohibited for security reasons.
Prohibition of connecting to degrading, abusive, violent, racist, discriminatory, pornographic, defamatory, or publicly offensive sites.
Prohibition of using SYSTRAN's network to violate third-party intellectual or industrial property rights.
Users must immediately inform the IT service of any technical malfunction or anomaly.

Rules for managing user credentials (identifiers and passwords), including initial password change, complexity requirements, and mandatory storage in 1Password.

entities.description: Act of counterfeiting, subject to civil and criminal penalties defined by the Intellectual Property Code.
Fine for alteration or suppression of data, accompanied by 2 years prison.
Fine for fraudulently introducing, suppressing, or modifying data, accompanied by 3 years prison.
Fine for counterfeiting, accompanied by 3 years prison.
